title: Clippy ICEs on `sentinel == STR_SENTINEL`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Committed a the [state of my repo](https://github.com/Kixiron/cranial-coitus/tree/c0c850a4cfcdf4e4bb36ab199ad398b842d87783) when I reported the bug, but this has been happening across many many changes and entirely different repos of code ### Meta ``` λ rustc -Vv rustc 1.59.0-nightly (0b42deacc 2021-12-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 0b42deaccc2cbe17a68067aa5fdb76104369e1fd commit-date: 2021-12-09 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 λ cargo -Vv cargo 1.58.0-nightly (40dc28175 2021-12-06) release: 1.58.0 commit-hash: 40dc281755137ee804bc9b3b08e782773b726e44 commit-date: 2021-12-06 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc libgit2: 1.3.0 (sys:0.13.23 vendored) libcurl: 7.80.0-DEV (sys:0.4.51+curl-7.80.0 vendored ssl:Schannel) os: Windows 10.0.19043 (Windows 10 Home) [64-bit] λ cargo clippy -- --version clippy 0.1.59 (0b42deac 2021-12-09) ``` ### Error output ``` λ cargo clippy Checking log v0.4.14 Checking parking_lot_core v0.8.5 Checking tracing-serde v0.1.2 Checking serde_json v1.0.72 Checking indexmap v1.7.0 Checking tracing v0.1.29 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: sentinel == STR_SENTINEL', /rustc/0b42deaccc2cbe17a68067aa5fdb76104369e1fd\compiler\rustc_serialize\src\opaque.rs:669:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (0b42deacc 2021-12-09) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: sentinel == STR_SENTINEL', /rustc/0b42deaccc2cbe17a68067aa5fdb76104369e1fd\compiler\rustc_serialize\src\opaque.rs:669:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (0b42deacc 2021-12-09) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: sentinel == STR_SENTINEL', /rustc/0b42deaccc2cbe17a68067aa5fdb76104369e1fd\compiler\rustc_serialize\src\opaque.rs:669:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: sentinel == STR_SENTINEL', /rustc/0b42deaccc2cbe17a68067aa5fdb76104369e1fd\compiler\rustc_serialize\src\opaque.rs:669:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: sentinel == STR_SENTINEL', /rustc/0b42deaccc2cbe17a68067aa5fdb76104369e1fd\compiler\rustc_serialize\src\opaque.rs:669:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: build failed ```
